data.title: Mitr Phol Leads Green Sugarcane Harvest for Sustainability
data.description: Mitr  Phol Group, a global leader in sustainable practices within the food products industry, continues its pioneering efforts to promote green sugarcane harvesting. For the 7th consecutive year, the company is purchasing sugarcane leaves through its “Let’s Green the Sugarcane” campaign, aiming to foster sustainable agricultural practices while providing cane growers with increased income opportunities.

data.title: Who is Pheu Thai’s ‘coup-killer’?
data.description: Prayut Siripanich, the MP behind the anti-coup bill, is no stranger to controversy. A decade ago, his amnesty proposal sparked turmoil

data.title: 19th INWEPF Steering Meeting and Symposium
data.description: Join us in exchanging global knowleage and technologies to promote improved water and rice ecosystem managemwnt, fostering sustainable water use among international networks and organizations.

data.title: Fresh storm alert for southern Thailand
data.description: Flooding and landslide alerts are in effect for all southern provinces near the Gulf of Thailand, with torrential rain forecast to pound the region until next Monday.

data.title: Mondelēz Thailand Drives Growth Through Consumer-Led Innovation
data.description: Mondelēz International (Thailand) Co., Ltd. has marked another exceptional year, driven by innovative marketing strategies and premium products that have resonated with Thai consumers. Standout campaigns including the viral Oreo Pokémon collaboration, new Halls XS flavours "Cola Chill" and "Lemon Soda," and Dentyne Splash Lychee enriched with collagen and vitamin C, have showcased the company

data.title: Sunbeams illuminate Chiang Mai's Royal Palace
data.description: A unique and breathtaking natural phenomenon captivates visitors to Ratchaphruek Royal Park in Chiang Mai

data.title: ‘Pad Kaprao’ most popular dish with over 800,000 orders in 2024
data.description: Foodpanda releases 2024 year-end statistics

data.title: Bangkok's Air Quality Crisis Demands Urgent Action Now
data.description: Greater Bangkok continues to face severe PM2.5 pollution levels, with the Pollution Control Department warning residents about thick smog from farmland burning and stagnant air masses over the capital and surrounding provinces. Despite annual recurrence, effective solutions remain elusive.

data.title: Many Maha Sarakham residents claim to have been scammed
data.description: Complainants say they were conned into putting their money into real estate schemes by two unscrupulous financiers

data.title: National Defence Organisation Act to undergo further revisions
data.description: Defence Ministry Administration Act also requires improvements before going channels, Defence Minister Phumtham says

data.title: BIG and Delta Revolutionise Electronics with Low-Carbon Nitrogen
data.description: BIG, a climate technology leader, has partnered with Delta Electronics (Thailand) Public Company Limited, a global innovator in power management and smart green solutions, to usher in a new era of sustainability in Thailand’s electronics industry. Announced on December 9, this strategic collaboration introduces low-carbon nitrogen into the production of electronic components and parts (ITC), setting a groundbreaking precedent for sustainable manufacturing in the region.

data.title: South Korea's Yoon vows to fight 'until the very last minute'
data.description: SEOUL - South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Thursday vowed to fight "until the very last minute" in a defiant address defending his shock decision last week to declare martial law and deploy troops to the country

data.title: Prachin Buri PAO chief in custody, suspected of links to man’s murder
data.description: Seven arrested after argument turns violent in Prachin Buri home, leaving a provincial council member dead

data.title: Fifa confirms Saudi Arabia as 2034 World Cup host
data.description: Fifa on Wednesday confirmed that Saudi Arabia will host the 2034 World Cup, underlining the Gulf kingdom

data.title: Hun Sen suggests Saudis invest in Kingdom’s rice industry
data.description: Hun Sen, president of the Cambodian Senate, has urged Saudi Arabia to purchase rice from Cambodia and encourage Saudi investors to invest in Cambodia’s rice production sector, particularly in processing and exporting rice to Saudi Arabia.

data.title: Hun Sen suggests Saudis invest in Kingdom’s rice industry
data.description: Hun Sen, president of the Cambodian Senate, has urged Saudi Arabia to purchase rice from Cambodia and encourage Saudi investors to invest in Cambodia’s rice production sector, particularly in processing and exporting rice to Saudi Arabia.

data.title: Philippines expected to import record rice volume
data.description: Despite record production and ample stocks, the Philippines is expected to import a record volume of rice in the 2024-25 crop year, according to a report from the Foreign Agricultural Service (FAS) of the US Department of Agriculture.

data.title: More Gong Yoo for you to stream
data.description: In The Trunk, South Korean heartthrob Gong Yoo plays a music producer who, believing he can never fall in love again after his divorce, hires a contractual wife for a year to fill the void. The romantic thriller rocketed to the number one spot on Netflix

data.title: Krungthai Unveils Global Savings Account for Smart Transactions
data.description: Krungthai Bank, Thailand’s leading commercial lank, is taking international banking to new heights with the launch of its Global Savings Account, designed to meet the needs of customers engaging in foreign transactions. This all-in-one account combines the convenience of global currency deposits, attractive interest rates, and competitive foreign exchange (FX) rates, making it ideal for anyone looking to manage investments, money transfers, and spending in multiple currencies.

data.title: Trendy flea market debuts at Princess's Cup
data.description: The Weekend & Lifestyle flea market will make its debut at the ongoing Princess

data.title: Kunlavut fast off the blocks
data.description: Kunlavut Vitidsarn got off to a strong start at the season-ending BWF World Tour Finals in Hangzhou, China, on Wednesday.

data.title: Tickets on sale in January
data.description: Tickets for the season-opening PT Grand Prix of Thailand 2025 will officially go on sale on Jan 9 next year.

data.title: A toast to 40 years of River City Bangkok
data.description: In celebration of its remarkable 40th anniversary, River City Bangkok presents two special exhibitions that offer a profound exploration of its storied legacy and enduring achievements -- a gateway to the world of art.

data.title: Ekanit returns as Thais aim for victory
data.description: Talented midfielder Ekanit Panya on Wednesday joined the Thai national team training camp for the ongoing Asean Mitsubishi Electric Cup 2024.

data.title: Migrant worker welfare training
data.description: The Labour Ministry is training a working team to provide labour welfare protection for migrant workers while also keeping them from taking jobs reserved for Thais.

data.title: iCon probe ends this month
data.description: The Department of Special Investigation (DSI) says its investigation into the scandal-hit The iCon Group will be finished before Dec 20, when the detention of 18 suspects ends.

data.title: Democracy is in need of workers
data.description: Donald Trump shocked the world in 2016 when he was elected US president, winning swing states in America

data.title: Govt 'won't mess with military'
data.description: The government has no intention of intervening in the military after a Pheu Thai MP proposed a bill to revise the Defence Ministry Administration Act, said Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra.

data.title: PM hints at release of detained crew
data.description: Four Thai crew members of a fishing vessel detained in Myanmar are expected to be released shortly after the New Year, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra suggested on Wednesday.

data.title: PM to delegate opposition's questions
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said she is ready to participate in the House general session when it convenes on Thursday.

data.title: Dozens of condo scam victims seek help
data.description: A group of 70 people have filed complaints with the Department of Special Investigation (DSI) claiming they were duped into purchasing  condominium units , resulting in total losses of 3 billion baht.

data.title: PM calls for comprehensive flood mitigation measures in the South
data.description: Paetongtarn promises to visit flood-hit region again to oversee progress

data.title: Explore the magic of rare rose varieties at Siam Paragon exhibition
data.description: Entry is free at event that displays some types for the first time in Thailand

data.title: Thai doctor warns of missing deadly viruses from Australian lab
data.description: Over 300 lab tubes contain BSL-4 pathogens that require the highest level of biosafety containment

data.title: ‘No public forum’ on Cambodia pact
data.description: No public forum will be held on the controversial 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) with  Cambodia  on maritime claims  in the Gulf of Thailand, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said on Wednesday.

data.title: Cabinet approves new laws for 15% minimum corporate tax
data.description: Move expected to attract investors and boost revenue by THB10 billion

data.title: Thai foreign minister visiting South Australia
data.description: Bilateral cooperation has been highlighted in the fields of agricultural technology, alternative energy and education during a visit by Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa to Adelaide, the capital of South Australia.
